intro: Chionanthus mayepea, commonly known as the whiteflower chionanthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Oleaceae family. It is characterized by its clusters of fragrant, white flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture. Chionanthus mayepea is native to parts of Central America and is often found in forested areas.
